message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with lattice problems, which are often studied in the context of computer science theory and cryptography. The focus on approximation factors slightly greater than one suggests that the paper may fall under the category of approximation algorithms or computational complexity. The use of search-to-decision reductions also suggests a connection to computational complexity. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are all possible categories. However, since the paper does not explicitly mention machine learning, it is less likely to fall under cs.LG.
